values.comments:
This course focuses on current issues in global health.

In general, students found this course “extremely interesting” and felt that the structure of the class “fostered a comfortable classroom environment” and “provided enough variety to stimulate and maintain student interest.” Many also felt that it taught them to “approach communication and information in many different ways” and particularly enjoyed the class discussions and debates on global health problems. Some students, however, didn’t feel like they “took a lot away” from the class, though they did not regret taking the class either.

Students unanimously agreed that Professor Johnson was “enthused,” “extremely knowledgeable,” and “cares very much whether her students are learning.” They also all agreed that she did a “good job of breaking up the long class period with breaks and different activities,” though one student felt that class discussions “lacked the fluidity and energy of some other seminars at Penn.”

Students recommended this course to both majors and non-majors alike.

*6 respondents.
